# Ex04 Places Around Me
## Date: 09-11-2025

## AIM
To develop a website to display details about the places around my house.

## DESIGN STEPS

### STEP 1
Create a Django admin interface.

### STEP 2
Download your city map from Google.

### STEP 3
Using ```<map>``` tag name the map.

### STEP 4
Create clickable regions in the image using ```<area>``` tag.

### STEP 5
Write HTML programs for all the regions identified.

### STEP 6
Execute the programs and publish them.

## CODE
```
map.html
<!-- Image Map Generated by http://www.image-map.net/ -->
<img src="Screenshot 2025-11-09 181319.png" usemap="#image-map">

<map name="image-map">
    <area target="" alt="parasur" title="parasur" href="parasur.html" coords="93,117,217,186" shape="rect">
    <area target="" alt="perumal temple" title="perumal temple" href="perumal temple.html" coords="398,474,603,560" shape="rect">
    <area target="" alt="sivan temple" title="sivan temple" href="sivan temple.html" coords="716,83,938,189" shape="rect">
</map>
parasur.html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>parasur</title>
</head>
<body>
    <h2>parasur.html</h2>
    <p>Parasur is a village and Gram Panchayat located in the Cheyyar taluka
         of the Tiruvannamalai district in the state of Tamil Nadu, India,
        The village is a gram panchayat, administered by an elected Sarpanch. 
        It falls under the Cheyyar Assembly Constituency and Arani Parliamentary Constituency.
        It covers a total geographical area of approximately 536.69 hectares (or 5.36 square kilometers).
         The Pincode of the locality is 604409</p>
    
</body>
</html>
perumal temple.html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>perumal temple</title>
</head>
<body>
    <h2>perumal temple.html</h2>
    <p>A Perumal temple is a Hindu temple dedicated to the deity Perumal,
         a form of Lord Vishnu, who is considered the supreme god in the Vaishnavism tradition. 
         These temples are predominantly found in South India, particularly in Tamil Nadu,
          and are central to the spiritual and cultural life of Tamil Hindus.
        Famous Perumal temples include the Varadharaja Perumal Temple in Kanchipuram, 
        the Ranganathaswamy Temple in Srirangam, the Adikesava Perumal Temple in Thiruvattar,
         and the Venkateswara Temple in Tirupati.</p>
    
</body>
</html>
sivan temple.html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>sivan temple</title>
</head>
<body>
    <h2>sivan temple.html</h2>
    <p>Sivan temples (Shiva temples) are Hindu places of worship dedicated to Lord Shiva,
         one of the principal deities of Hinduism who is considered the creator, preserver, transformer, and destroyer.
          These temples are significant spiritual hubs, often featuring the Shiva Lingam as the central icon,
           symbolizing the infinite, formless nature of ShivaThe main deity is Shiva, 
           primarily worshipped in the aniconic form of a Lingam, often placed in the inner sanctum (garbhagriha or karuvarai).</p>
    
</body>
</html>




## OUTPUT
c:\Users\admin\Pictures\parasur.html.png
c:\Users\admin\Pictures\sivan temple.html.png
c:\Users\admin\Pictures\perumal temple.html.png







## RESULT
The program for implementing image maps using HTML is executed successfully.
